For some more background you might want  to visit the following bug report:  https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=338621  --> <?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="/WebResource.axd?d=OG6ICBS3XdykvyL_wBngEtwfPZ1xqVL3SJbFznhjfEgbO7QCYjHbDfgdgnO_5IYl31FcIeZ2u_qHqs8zCgU_y6DDpKxLyAV4MxNJVxfxbqAA9wnJHfwytgbvEYfRnFp2CKySbJEfaqzaXNpSNK6oTGhGshY1&t=635319500310794128" media="screen"?> <feed xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns:content="http://purl.org/rss/1.0/modules/content/" xmlns:media="http://search.yahoo.com/mrss/">   <title>Computer Science</title>   <subtitle>The School of Computer Science undertakes world-class research which feeds directly into undergraduate teaching via an exciting range of optional modules and research-related project work. We provide exciting and up-to-date taught programmes delivered by international experts in their field.</subtitle>   <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/computerscience/computerscience.aspx?SyndicationType=2" />   <generator>Contensis: http://www.contentmanagement.co.uk</generator>   <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/computerscience/computerscience.aspx?SyndicationType=2</id>   <updated>2015-03-12T19:56:14Z</updated>   <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/computerscience/computerscience.aspx?SyndicationType=2" rel="self" type="application/atom+xml" />   <entry>     <title>Computer Science BSc</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/computerscience/bsc-computer-science.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Jayne Holgate</name>     </author>     <summary>Computer Science BSc. This course is designed to produce high-quality graduates who show independent thought, flexibility and maturity, and who command a sound technical knowledge of the broad aspects of computer science. You will gain an appreciation of current computing practice so that the skills you learn can be applied immediately after graduation.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:06:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-02T16:47:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/computerscience/bsc-computer-science.aspx</id>     <category term="computer science BSc" />     <category term="undergraduate" />     <category term="Degree" />     <category term="computer science" />     <category term="university of nottingham" />     <category term="course" />   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Computer Science MSci</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/computerscience/msci-computer-science.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Jayne Holgate</name>     </author>     <summary>computer science MSci. This course is designed to produce high-quality graduates who show independent thought, flexibility and maturity, and who command a sound technical knowledge of the broad aspects of computer science. You will gain an appreciation of current computing practice so that the skills you learn can be applied immediately after graduation.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:04:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-02T16:50:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/computerscience/msci-computer-science.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Computer Science including International Year MSci</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/computerscience/msci-computer-science-including-international-year.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Jayne Holgate</name>     </author>     <summary>This four-year course provides the broad, in-depth computer science training of the G404 MSci Computer Science, with the added dimension of an international study year. You will learn about current computing practice that can be applied immediately after graduation, foundational aspects of computing that will be of lasting value as technology changes over time, and research-level topics that will play an important role in future developments.</summary>     <published>2014-01-16T11:39:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-02T16:48:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/computerscience/msci-computer-science-including-international-year.aspx</id>     <category term="computer science MSci" />     <category term="university of nottingham" />     <category term="degree course" />   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Computer Science With Year in Industry BSc</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/computerscience/bsc-computer-science-with-year-in-industry.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Jayne Holgate</name>     </author>     <summary>Computer Science BSc. This course is designed to produce high-quality graduates who show independent thought, flexibility and maturity, and who command a sound technical knowledge of the broad aspects of computer science. You will gain an appreciation of current computing practice so that the skills you learn can be applied immediately after graduation.</summary>     <published>2014-06-25T10:21:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-02T17:00:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/computerscience/bsc-computer-science-with-year-in-industry.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Computer Science with Artificial Intelligence BSc</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/computerscience/bsc-computer-science-artificial-intelligence.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Jayne Holgate</name>     </author>     <summary>computer science with artificial intelligence BSc. This course is designed to offer both a general understanding of computer science as well as specialist skills in artificial intelligence. In addition to fundamental computer science classes and laboratories, the course covers topics including intelligent agents, the history and philosophy of artificial intelligence, neural networks, heuristic optimisation and other intelligent systems.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:06:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-02T16:52:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/computerscience/bsc-computer-science-artificial-intelligence.aspx</id>     <category term="computer science with artificial intelligence BSc" />     <category term="university of nottingham" />     <category term="undergraduate" />     <category term="Degree" />     <category term="course" />   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Computer Science with Artificial Intelligence MSci</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/computerscience/msci-computer-science-artificial-intelligence.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Jayne Holgate</name>     </author>     <summary>computer science with artificial intelligence MSci. This course is designed to produce high-quality graduates who show independent thought, flexibility and maturity, and who command a sound technical knowledge of the broad aspects of computer science and artificial intelligence. You will gain an appreciation of current practice in both computer science and in artificial intelligence that can be applied immediately after graduation.</summary> BSc</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/computerscience/software-engineering.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Jayne Holgate</name>     </author>     <summary>Software Engineering BSc. This is a practically oriented degree focusing on the design and implementation of large software systems, particularly those with interactive or multimedia components.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:06:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-02T16:40:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/computerscience/software-engineering.aspx</id>     <category term="software engineering BSc" />     <category term="computer science" />     <category term="university of nottingham" />     <category term="course" />     <category term="undergraduate" />     <category term="Degree" />   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Data Science BSc</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/computerscience/bsc-data-science.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Maryam Marchenko</name>     </author>     <summary>3 year full time undergraduate course</summary>     <published>2014-06-25T10:47:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-02-27T12:29:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/computerscience/bsc-data-science.aspx</id>   </entry> </feed>
